H0.text: The water evaporates and the salt remains in the beaker when salt water is boiled.

H1.text: Both the salt and the water evaporate and leave the beaker when salt water is boiled.

H2.text: The salt becomes a new compound when salt water is boiled.

H3.text: The salt will evaporate from the water and disperse into the environment when salt water is boiled.

A4.text: Evaporation is a type of vaporization that occurs on the surface of a liquid as it changes into the gas phase.

A5.text: If a liquid is heated, when the vapor pressure reaches the ambient pressure the liquid will boil.
